subject: Sales
title: Transparency as a Strategy
description: A 60-second lesson on Transparency as a Strategy.

hook.text: Patagonia ran an ad: 'Don't Buy This Jacket.' Sales jumped 30%. Honesty sold better than hype.

buildup.text: Radical transparency disarms buyer skepticism. Admitting flaws first makes strengths more believable.

discovery.text: Buffer published every employee salary publicly. Job applications surged. Openness attracts talent.

twist.text: Transparency must be genuine. Performative honesty is just manipulation wearing a different mask.

climax.text: In a world drowning in spin, real transparency is the most disruptive sales strategy available.

punchline.text: In a world of spin, truth is the best strategy.

quiz.question: What happened when Patagonia told people not to buy their jacket?
